Qualifiers.Scope: Regulations for the design, placement, and dimensions of below-grade patios, including associated lightwells and stairwells, on a residential lot.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to all excavated features such as below-grade patios. These features are explicitly prohibited on the side of a structure that faces the front yard.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: The area measurement for a single patio's 200 sf limit explicitly excludes any area devoted to required stairway egress.

Variables.combined_patio_area: The sum of the areas of all below-grade patios on the lot. Measured by interior dimension.
Variables.lot_area: The total area of the lot.
Variables.single_patio_area: The area of an individual below-grade patio. Measured by interior dimension.
Variables.stairway_egress_area: The area specifically designated for a required stairway egress.
Variables.separation_distance: The distance separating one below-grade patio area from another.
Variables.side_yard_encroachment_distance: The distance a feature extends into the required side yard setback.
Variables.rear_yard_encroachment_distance: The distance a feature extends into the required rear yard setback.
Variables.combined_encroachment_length: The sum of the lengths of all portions of excavated features that encroach into any required yards.
Variables.overhang_canopy_area: The area of any overhangs or canopies installed to shelter a below-grade patio.

Constants.measurement_procedure: All area and length measurements are based on the interior dimension of the opening and exclude the enclosing structure.

Conditions.Mandatory: Location: Must not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard. Separation: Each below-grade area must be separated from another by at least 10 feet. Environmental: Excavated features must not be harmful to neighboring trees. (Flag: 'harmful' is ambiguous and requires definition). Drainage: A drainage system must be installed and approved. Architectural: Must be architecturally compatible with the main residence. (Flag: 'architecturally compatible' is ambiguous and requires definition). Screening: Must be screened from off-site views. Lot Coverage: Any sheltering overhangs or canopies must be included in lot coverage calculations.
Conditions.Optional: The method of screening can be landscaping, fencing, or a combination of both, subject to department approval.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: Combined Area Limit: The total combined area of all below-grade patios must not exceed the greater of (2% of the lot area) or (200 sf). Single Area Limit: The area of any single below-grade patio must not exceed 200 sf. Side Yard Encroachment: Allowable encroachment into a required side yard is a maximum of 2 feet. Rear Yard Encroachment: Allowable encroachment into a required rear yard is a maximum of 4 feet. Combined Encroachment Length: The combined length of all encroaching portions of features across all yards may not exceed 15 feet.

Exceptions.area_calculation_exclusion: When calculating the area of a single patio against its 200 sf limit, the area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the calculation.

Relationships.Hierarchical: These standards govern 'below-grade patios', which encompass related features like 'lightwells & stairwells'.
Relationships.Cross-references: The area of 'overhangs or canopies' sheltering a patio is explicitly linked to and must be counted towards the separate 'lot coverage' regulation.
Relationships.Dependencies: Approval for the drainage system is required from the Public Works Department. The appropriateness of the screening method (landscaping and/or fencing) is determined by the Planning Department.
